item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture across India’s equity markets, as 4,094 companies declared results. While the proportion of firms reporting positive earnings has edged up slightly to 46.0%, sectoral and market-capitalisation distinctions highlight a complex landscape for investors to navigate. Time: Feb 28 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Are Rain Industries Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Rain Industries Ltd's latest results show a year-on-year recovery with a net profit of ₹13.51 crores, up from a loss last year, but a significant quarter-on-quarter decline of 87.26% raises concerns about sustainability, alongside a decrease in sales and operating margins. Overall, while there are positive trends, recent challenges suggest the need for careful monitoring of future performance. Time: Feb 28 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Are Jagatjit Industries Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Jagatjit Industries Ltd's latest results are concerning, showing a net profit of ₹64.40 crore primarily due to a one-time income, while underlying operations reflect a loss of ₹16.95 crore and an 80.65% drop in net sales year-on-year, indicating severe operational distress and high debt levels. Time: Feb 28 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Are K&R Rail Engineering Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: K&R Rail Engineering Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results are concerning, showing a net loss of ₹0.86 crores and a 92.21% year-on-year revenue decline, indicating severe operational challenges and a need for urgent improvements. Despite a debt-free balance sheet, the company's deteriorating performance metrics and lack of institutional interest raise significant doubts about its sustainability. Time: Feb 28 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Are Vesuvius India Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Vesuvius India Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results show strong profitability with a net profit of ₹80.23 crores, up 30.37% quarter-on-quarter, but concerns arise from high valuation metrics and reliance on increased other income. Overall, the performance is solid, yet investors should be cautious about sustainability and earnings quality. Time: Feb 28 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture across market capitalisations, reflecting a cautious yet improving corporate performance landscape. With 4,094 companies reporting results, the proportion of positive earnings has edged up modestly to 46.0%, signalling a gradual recovery from the subdued trends seen earlier in the year. Time: Feb 28 2026 06:00 PM IST

item.title: Wardwizard Foods Declines 3.74%: Earnings and Valuation Challenges Shape Week
item.description: Wardwizard Foods & Beverages Ltd experienced a challenging week on the BSE, with its stock price declining 3.74% from ₹9.10 on 13 Feb 2026 to ₹8.76 on 20 Feb 2026, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by mixed trading sessions influenced by the company’s Q3 FY26 results revealing revenue growth but persistent profitability struggles, alongside a detailed valuation analysis highlighting elevated risk metrics and subdued market sentiment. Time: Feb 28 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Rallis India Gains 7.80%: Four Key Factors Driving This Week’s Momentum
item.description: Rallis India Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 7.80% from Rs.264.60 to Rs.285.25 between 16 and 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain over the same period. The stock’s trajectory was shaped by a series of technical momentum shifts, an upgrade in investment rating, and robust financial results, all contributing to renewed investor interest amid a mixed sector backdrop. Time: Feb 28 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Sangal Papers Gains 1.35%: Stabilisation and Valuation Shift Drive Weekly Performance
item.description: Sangal Papers Ltd closed the week at Rs.199.00, marking a 1.35% gain from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.196.35, outperforming the Sensex which rose 0.39% over the same period. The week was characterised by a stabilisation in the company’s quarterly financial performance, an upgrade in its investment rating from Strong Sell to Sell, and a notable improvement in valuation metrics amidst ongoing sector challenges. Despite sideways price movement midweek, the stock demonstrated resilience relative to the broader market, reflecting cautious investor sentiment amid mixed fundamental signals. Time: Feb 28 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Last Mile Enterprises Gains 2.06%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Week
item.description: Last Mile Enterprises Ltd recorded a modest weekly gain of 2.06%, closing at Rs.6.44 on 20 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex which rose 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by sharp intraday volatility driven by a significant financial downturn announcement and a contrasting surge in revenue masking profit collapse. These developments influenced trading volumes and price swings, reflecting investor caution amid deteriorating fundamentals. Time: Feb 28 2026 05:15 PM IST

item.title: Vishvprabha Ventures Declines 4.95%: Financial Struggles and Valuation Risks Weigh
item.description: Vishvprabha Ventures Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its stock price falling 4.95% from Rs.59.80 to Rs.56.84, underperforming the BSE Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a steep quarterly loss announcement, a downgrade to a Strong Sell rating, heightened valuation risks, and a fall to a 52-week low, all contributing to bearish sentiment and volatile trading. Time: Feb 28 2026 05:15 PM IST
